subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
[[File:Britannica Rattlesnake.jpg|thumb|120px|A venomous snake, from which this character originated.]]
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}}: a snake.

The character originally represented a type of venomous snake, while the derivative {{l|zh|蟲}} represented worms and insects (or insect-like things). {{lang|zh|虫}} was later borrowed for {{l|zh|蟲}} (possibly via simplification), and the character {{l|zh|虺}} was created to represent the original meaning.
